King Faisal is killed in a coup led by Abdul Karim Kassem.
Kassem is overthrown and executed, and the Baath Party takes over.
Hussein returns from Cairo.
The new Baath government is overthrown before the end of the year.
In a bloodless coup, Major General Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr of the Baath party becomes Iraq's new president.
Hussein becomes secretary and acting deputy chairman of the Revolutionary Command Council.
Hussein and Shah Mohammed Reza Pahlavi of Iran sign a treaty.
Iraq gives up claims to the Shatt-al-Arab waterway, while Iran agrees to end its support of the independence seeking Kurds.
Hussein becomes the fifth president of Iraq with the retirement of President Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr.
Iraq launches an air attack against Iran.
The war ends in a stalemate in 1988, with approximately one million deaths.
Hussein orders a poison gas attack on Kurds in Halabja in northern Iraq.
More than 5,000 people are killed.
Iraq invades Kuwait, the beginning of the Persian Gulf War.
Hussein is re-elected president.
Great Britain and the United States launch air strikes against Iraq.
The attack, called Operation Desert Fox, is in response to Iraq's refusal to cooperate with United Nations weapons inspectors.
US president George W. Bush
Iraqi Foreign Minister Naji Sabri delivers a letter to the UN from Hussein stating that Iraq has no chemical, nuclear, or biological weapons.
Hussein is re-elected to a seven-year term with 100% of the Iraqi vote, according to the Iraqi government.
CBS airs Dan Rather's interview with Hussein on "60 Minutes II," in which he offers to debate President Bush on a live global satellite broadcast.
The second Gulf War begins, code named Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Hussein makes his first appearance in court at his arraignment and is charged with a variety of crimes, including the invasion of Kuwait and the gassing of the Kurds.
He pleads innocent.
The Iraqi Special Tribunal (IST) files the first criminal charges against him, for the 1982 massacre in Dujail.
Hussein's trial begins in Baghdad.
Hussein is hospitalized after suffering from the effects of a hunger strike, launched in protest of his ongoing trial.
Hussein is convicted and sentenced to death by hanging for the Dujail massacre.
Per Iraqi law there is an automatic appeal to every death sentence.
An appellate chamber of the Iraqi High Tribunal upholds the death sentence.
By Iraqi law the execution must take place within 30 days.
Hussein is hanged
